mention_address: "Boulder Bay Park, Big Bear Boulevard, Big Bear Lake, San Bernardino County, California, 92315, United States of America"
attraction_reviewComments: Park is always clean and well kept city does a great job All we need now is water in the lake It's sad water is so low that people can't enjoy it
It's just a real pretty place to walk and get a great view of the lake. It's nice to take the kids and the pets to stroll and walk down the dock over the water.
The weather was perfect. A little windy but you can't get any better than this when it comes to nature. The drought has affected other small beaches but not here. Check it out and... read more
This little park was not far from the cabin we rented. There were lot of ducks and swans to keep us entertained. Also, a really nice place to just sit and relax.
This is a pretty lake front park. This last trip the water level was really low so it wasn't quite as nice, but clean and nice place for the kids to run around
This park is LAKEFRONT in the ROCKY area of BIG BEAR LAKE & is MOST SCENIC & RELAXING especially in the evenings ! GREAT walking area ! A MUST see !
Nice little park with a panoramic view of the lake. Great place for a picnic or a little stroll along the lake. The park was somewhat overrated in my opinion. We had a feeling... read more
park right on the lake. I love the big boulders and the trees surrounding it. We had a picnic there and the kids played football. It was great!!
We stopped here on the way out of Big Bear. The park is very clean, has plenty of seats to admire the spectacular views. Many people we're fishing for bass I believe. It was very... read more
Nice little park with a beautiful view of the lake. Great place for a picnic or a little stroll along the lake.
well kept little park with a ramp down to the water (which is VERY low right now). Dog friendly, has some nice big rocks to play on.
Great Park for all--humans and dogs alike. The park provided good views of the Lake and had plenty of parking spaces.
